study: CT Angiography of Head and Neck
indication: Transient ischemic attack (TIA), rule out vascular stenosis
content:
Findings:
Intracranial Arteries: Normal opacification of the intracranial arteries without evidence of aneurysm or stenosis.
Carotid Arteries: Significant narrowing (70%) of the right internal carotid artery. Left carotid artery appears patent.
Vertebral Arteries: Bilaterally patent with no stenosis.
Brain Parenchyma: No evidence of infarct or hemorrhage.

Impression:
Significant stenosis of the right internal carotid artery. Recommend vascular surgery evaluation.
No acute intracranial abnormalities.
